review_title: I can't imagine a worse culture
job_title: Management in Draper, UT
pros: The best reasons for working at LDS Business College is that you are essentially an employee of the LDS Church, which offers great benefits.
cons:
- Academic leadership can't make a strategic or consistent decision. They are constantly changing their minds and never fully developing an idea to fruition before coming up with another distraction.
- The new president has destroyed the culture. Everyone is afraid of losing their jobs. Why? Because he fires someone without cause literally monthly. And there are less than 100 employees. In an environment that small, people notice when fresh blood is on the walls.
- The president is overly concerned with pleasing his superiors to actually come up with an original thought or idea. Nobody trusts him. Employees obviously say they do, because the alternative is to be out on the street.
- Be warned; think twice before coming here. Notice that most of the positive reviews on this site are actually from student employees who are oblivious to the real employment culture.

review_title: Great College, Great Employer, Awesome President
job_title: Vice President of Administration in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
The College exudes a spirit of hope and optimism as it exists to help people gain practical skills to get a great job - way earlier than someone might who is pursuing a bachelor's degree. The students are amazing and excited to be here. 

The president is a wonderful man who is incredibly gifted and remarkably intelligent, witty, and kind.  He is one of the more empathetic and caring bosses I have had in my career. He aligns with the Church's General Authorities and Board of Trustees as he works incredibly hard to provide a nurturing environment for and and all students as well as the staff.
cons:
I'm personally not a fan of wearing a tie everyday, but that is such a small concern, especially when compared to the wonderful work environment that is LDS Business College. 

I am aware of some unprofessional and ill-informed smear reviews on this site regarding the College and its leadership. Reading those, I'm convinced they are written by the same person who is either a disgruntled former employee, or who is an enemy of the Church and is looking to troll any person who is in a leadership position or visible role - such as the president of one of the Church's colleges. Believe me, I work here daily, and the place is great - the staff and faculty are like family. We may not always agree, but we are agreeable, and we have each other's backs.

review_title: I often say to myself, 'I can't believe I actually get to work in a place like this!'
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saratoga Springs, UT
pros:
LDSBC has given me the opportunity to interact with some of the best of souls who walk this earth. I’ve spent about ten years on this campus and have met students from all over the world who have overcome the most difficult things, and there are many current and former staff and faculty who truly consecrate their entire souls into making this place better.
 
The camaraderie I’ve experienced among my colleagues has always been a highlight for me. There’s a family feel about this place that I hope never goes away. These relationships I’ve been able to build have made my employment here invaluable.  

This is a prayerful campus. The week begins with all of the employees briefly gathering together to discuss the week’s agenda, share great things happening on campus among the students, sing a hymn, share a spiritual thought, and then offer a prayer on behalf of all the students. The majority of meetings begin with a prayer, and I believe all of the classes do as well (at least they are supposed to). 

The concerted effort to make Jesus the very center of our lives and look to Him as the perfect leader and moral exemplar is my most favorite part about working here. I experience this on a weekly basis from the enormous support I receive from my supervisor, kindhearted words of support and encouragement (and sometimes great jokes) I often receive from the president, and familial interactions and personal ministry I am a beneficiary of from the rest of the staff and faculty. No one here is perfect, but it’s clear to me that those among the full-time employees are here because they genuinely love the Lord and want to make a meaningful contribution.
cons:
My commute to and from work totals 2 1/2 hours a day, but this is my fault because of where I chose to live.  Although, sometimes it's nice to use this time to decompress at the end of the day. 

It's always disappointing for me when someone is hired who doesn't fully support the mission of the College, its standards, its leaders, and/or the expectation that they should support the devotional series by regularly attending it. I'm not judging anyone who does or did fall into this category, but this is sad for me to watch because I care about the people at LDSBC and those who do fall into this category usually aren't happy here when they are not bought in to these three things.
